unstructured.description: Signed study specific informed consent form prior to study registration
Histologic confirmation of adenocarcinoma of the prostate by biopsy

At least one of the following features indicating intermediate-risk disease:
* PSA >= 10 ng/mL
* Gleason score 7
* T2b or T2c disease
Up to 6 months of previous hormonal therapy is allowed (but not required)
PSA =< 20 prior to hormone therapy (if given)
No direct evidence of regional or distant metastases after appropriate staging studies
American Urological Association (AUA) score =< 15 (alpha blockers allowed)
Computed tomography (CT) or ultrasound-based volume estimation of prostate gland =< 100 cc
Clinical or radiographic evidence of disease involving regional lymph nodes or distant metastases

Any of the following features indicating high-risk disease:
* PSA > 20 ng/mL
* Gleason score > 7
* T3 or T4 disease (based on clinical examination and staging imaging)
Prior invasive malignancy (excluding non-melanomatous skin cancers) unless disease-free for a minimum of 3 years
Prior treatment for prostate cancer, with the exception of hormonal therapy for up to 6 months
Previous transurethral resection of the prostate (TURP)
Previous hormonal therapy given for more than 6 months prior to therapy
History of Crohn’s disease or ulcerative colitis
Ultrasound or CT estimate of prostate volume > 100 cc

detail_description:
PRIMARY OBJECTIVE:
I. To evaluate the feasibility and safety of delivering image-guided hypofractionated radiotherapy with real-time tracking in one or five fractions for intermediate risk prostate cancer.

SECONDARY OBJECTIVES:
I. To characterize the toxicity profiles of two hypofractionated radiotherapy regimens when administered as definitive treatment for intermediate risk prostate cancer.
II. To evaluate clinical outcomes, including prostate specific antigen (PSA) kinetics, radiographic responses, pathologic responses, biochemical and clinical disease recurrence rates, and overall survival, following hypofractionated radiotherapy for intermediate risk prostate cancer.
III. To evaluate patient-reported outcomes following treatment with hypofractionated radiotherapy for intermediate risk prostate cancer.

OUTLINE: Patients are randomized to 1 of 2 arms.

ARM A: Patients undergo hypofractionated radiation therapy over 30 minutes every 2-3 days over approximately 2 weeks for a total of 5 sessions. 

ARM B: Patients undergo radiation therapy over 30 minutes once. 

After completion of study treatment, patients are followed up at 6, 12, 18 and 24 months, then periodically for up to 5 years.
official_title: A Pilot Study of Ultra-High-Dose Hypofractionated or Single-Dose Radiotherapy for Intermediate Risk Prostate Cancer

outcome_measures.timeframe: Within 3 months of completion of protocol radiation
outcome_measures.name: Dose limiting toxicity
outcome_measures.description: Defined as any Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE) version 4.0 grade >= 3 urinary or rectal toxicity that is observed within 3 months of completion of protocol radiation.

outcome_measures.name: Incidence of adverse events
outcome_measures.description: Assessed by CTCAE version 4.0. Toxicity outcomes and patterns of failures will be summarized and tabulated along with Clopper-Pearson exact 95% confidence intervals. Exploratory comparisons will be made using Fisher’s exact, chi-square, or Wilcoxon rank sum tests, as appropriate.

outcome_measures.name: Pathologic response rates
outcome_measures.description: Will be examined using chi-square tests followed by generalized linear models.

outcome_measures.name: Prostate specific antigen (PSA) relapse free survival
outcome_measures.description: Will be examined using the Kaplan-Meier survival procedure.

outcome_measures.name: Quality of life
outcome_measures.description: Quality of life domains are assessed repeatedly over the follow-up period, in order to account for repeated measurements and within-subject correlation, will perform exploratory generalized linear models for repeated (continuous or binary) outcomes, as appropriate.

outcome_measures.name: Sexual function
outcome_measures.description: Will be examined using chi-square tests followed by generalized linear models.

arms.name: Arm A (hypofractionated radiation therapy)
arms.description: Patients undergo hypofractionated radiation therapy over 30 minutes every 2-3 days over approximately 2 weeks for a total of 5 sessions.

arms.name: Arm B (radiation therapy)
arms.description: Patients undergo radiation therapy over 30 minutes once.

brief_summary: This trial investigates the side effects of hypofractionated radiation therapy and how well it works in treating patients with intermediate risk prostate cancer. Radiation therapy uses high energy x-rays to kill tumor cells and shrink tumors. Hypofractionated radiation therapy delivers higher doses of radiation therapy over a shorter period of time and may kill more tumor cells and have fewer side effects. Giving higher doses of radiation therapy over a shorter period of time (hypofractionated radiation therapy) may work better than lower doses over a longer period of time (intensity-modulated radiation therapy) in treating patients with prostate cancer.
brief_title: Ultra-High-Dose Hypofractionated or Single-Dose Radiotherapy for the Treatment of Intermediate Risk Prostate Cancer
